page.title: 02Peak Dale _ An Overview
page.content: The underlying limestone also affects the type of farming carried out within the block.As the limestone is covered by a thin layer of soil,the land is used for grazing,for silage or for hay.The principal animals kept are dairy cattle and sheep. However,the type of farming is also influenced by two other factors: _As limestone is dissolved by water,streams and rivers create steep sided valleys which are difficult to cultivate; _As the land is around 300 metres above sea level,the growing season is substantially shortened,making grass the only viable crop. Thus this block is essentially an upland area containing a village,a number of small hamlets and farms dependent on farming and quarrying for their existence.
